Comments_List: I learnt a lot about isotope systems, both stable and unstable isotopes.
Decay equations, Data display using radiogenic isotope systems, specific methods used in the field
In-depth discussion of isotope systems, geochronology, measurement methods, propagation of error, U-Pb systematics and applications for various isotope systems.
The course covered most important isotope systems, and it gives us an overall impression of geochemistry.

Strengths - the confusing or difficult sections were explained multiple times and thoroughly, the lecture slides were easy to read and understand after the fact, very little homework, open book midterm during Fall 2018
Weaknesses - A little repetitive at times, could have been more challenging intellectually

More structure with readings to enhance lecture would be helpful. I thought that problem sets worked well, but could also be used as an opportunity to look at raw data and understand the applications of isotope theory.

Strengths- instructor with in depth knowledge of subject matter, availability for questions, excellent textbook and online resources that were informative and provided multiple modes of explanation. Problem sets were educational, and aligned with the course learning objects. Enjoyed having post doc presentations to learn about other research in the department. 

Weaknesses- student background was a little disparate, especially between graduates and undergraduates. More clarification would have been nice IRT what sort of equations were necessarily to memorize etc.
Yes, cause I think this course is important to students in geology. It will be a great toll to use in geology studies.

Yes! Alan is an entertaining lecturer and an understanding instructor. He is approachable and clearly loves to talk about geochemistry. This is a great course to take if you are entirely unfamiliar with isotope geochemistry.
Yes, isotope geochemistry was a useful course and there were plenty of resources to delve deeper into the material than could be covered in lecture.
Yes- useful course for someone interested in pursuing geosciences
